trans-unit.source: "I heard you, it's here, but try this instead (you are not allowed to see it)"
trans-unit.target: "我听你说了,就在这里,不过你可以试试这个(不准你看)"

trans-unit.source: "The request requires user authentication."
trans-unit.target: “该请求需要用户身份验证 。”

trans-unit.source: (If the server wants to keep this information from client)
trans-unit.target: (如果服务器希望对客户机保留这些信息)

trans-unit.source: (Not Found) can be used instead.
trans-unit.target: (未找到)可以用它来代替。

trans-unit.source: ... Authorization will not help ...
trans-unit.target: ...授权不会帮助.....

trans-unit.source: ... If the request already included Authorization credentials, then the 401 response indicates that authorization has been refused for those credentials. ...
trans-unit.target: ...如果请求中已经包含了授权凭证,那么401的响应表明这些凭证的授权已经被拒绝。...

trans-unit.source: 10.4.2 401 Unauthorized
10.4.4 403 Forbidden
10.4.4 403 Forbidden The server understood the request but is refusing to fulfil it. Authorization will not help and the request SHOULD NOT be repeated.
trans-unit.target: 10.4.4.4 403 被禁止 服务器理解请求,但拒绝执行。授权将无济于事,并且不应该重复该请求。

trans-unit.source: 3.1. 401 Unauthorized
401 Unauthorized (10.4.2)
401 Unauthorized:
trans-unit.target: 401未经授权。

trans-unit.source: 401 if not logged-in or session expired
trans-unit.target: 401,如果未登录或者会话过期,则401

trans-unit.source: 401 indicates that the resource can not be provided, but the server is REQUESTING that the client log in through HTTP Authentication and has sent reply headers to initiate the process. Possibly there are authorizations that will permit access to the resource, possibly there are not, but let's give it a try and see what happens.
trans-unit.target: 401表示无法提供该资源,但服务器要求客户端通过HTTP身份验证登录,并已发送回复头来启动该过程。可能有可能有允许访问该资源的授权,也有可能没有,但让我们试一试,看看会发生什么。

trans-unit.source: 401 is for unauthenticated ("lacks valid authentication"); i.e. 'I don't know who you are, or I don't trust you are who you say you are.'
trans-unit.target: 401用于未认证 （“缺少有效认证”）； 即“我不知道你是谁，或者我不相信你是你所说的那个人。”

trans-unit.source: 401: A refusal that has to do with authentication
trans-unit.target: 401:与认证有关的拒绝行为

trans-unit.source: 401: You need HTTP basic auth to see this.
trans-unit.target: 401:你需要HTTP基本认证才能看到这个。

trans-unit.source: 403 Forbidden (10.4.4)
403 Forbidden is used when access to the resource is forbidden to everyone or restricted to a given network or allowed only over SSL, whatever as long as it is no related to HTTP authentication.
trans-unit.target: 403 Forbidden是在禁止所有人访问资源或限制在指定的网络上,或只允许通过SSL,只要与HTTP认证无关的情况下,都可以使用。

trans-unit.source: 403 Forbidden vs 401 Unauthorized HTTP responses
trans-unit.target: 403禁止与401未授权的HTTP响应的对比

trans-unit.source: 403 Forbidden:
403 if user does not have permission to access resource (file, json, ...)
trans-unit.target: 403 如果用户没有访问资源的权限(文件、json、...),则为403。

trans-unit.source: 403 indicates that the resource can not be provided and there is, for the current user, no way to solve this through RFC2617 and no point in trying. This may be because it is known that no level of authentication is sufficient (for instance because of an IP blacklist), but it may be because the user is already authenticated and does not have authority. The RFC2617 model is one-user, one-credentials so the case where the user may have a second set of credentials that could be authorized may be ignored. It neither suggests nor implies that some sort of login page or other non-RFC2617 authentication protocol may or may not help - that is outside the RFC2616 standards and definition.
trans-unit.target: 403表示无法提供该资源,对于当前用户来说,没有办法通过RFC2617解决这个问题,也没有必要尝试。这可能是因为众所周知,没有一个级别的认证是不够的(比如因为IP黑名单的原因),但也可能是因为用户已经通过了认证,没有权限。RFC2617的模式是单用户、单凭证,所以用户可能有第二组凭证可以被授权的情况可以忽略。它既没有暗示也没有暗示某种登录页面或其他非RFC2617认证协议可能会或不可能有帮助--这不在RFC2616标准和定义的范围之内。

trans-unit.source: 403 is for unauthorized ("refuses to authorize"); i.e. 'I know who you are, but you don't have permission to access this resource.'
trans-unit.target: 403用于未授权 （“拒绝授权”）； 即“我知道您是谁，但您无权访问此资源。”

trans-unit.source: 403: A refusal that has NOTHING to do with authentication
trans-unit.target: 403:拒绝与认证无关的拒绝。

trans-unit.source: 403: You can't see this, and HTTP basic auth won't help.
trans-unit.target: 403:你看不出来,HTTP基本认证也无济于事。

trans-unit.source: 404 (Not Found).
404 if resource does not exist (or not willing to reveal anything)
trans-unit.target: 404,如果资源不存在(或不愿意透露任何东西)。

trans-unit.source: 6.5.3. 403 Forbidden
Section 6.5.3 in this draft (authored by Fielding and Reschke) gives status code 403 a slightly different meaning to the one documented in RFC 2616.
trans-unit.target: 该草案的6.5.3节 （由Fielding和Reschke编写）为状态代码403赋予了与RFC 2616中记录的含义稍有不同的含义。

trans-unit.source: 401 Unauthorized?
trans-unit.target: 401 Unauthorized ？

trans-unit.source: 403 Forbidden?
trans-unit.target: 403 Forbidden 吗？

trans-unit.source: Edit: RFC2616 is obsolete, see RFC7231 and RFC7235.
trans-unit.target: 编辑： RFC2616已过时，请参阅RFC7231和RFC7235 。

trans-unit.source: More details:
trans-unit.target: 更多细节：

trans-unit.source: Note on the RFC based on comments received to this answer:
trans-unit.target: 基于对此答案收到的注释，在RFC上进行说明：

trans-unit.source: 400: That's neither 401 nor 403, as syntax errors should always return 400.
trans-unit.target: 400 ：既不是401也不是403，因为语法错误应始终返回400。

trans-unit.source: 401 Unauthorized
trans-unit.target: 401未经授权

trans-unit.source: 401 Unauthorized: I don't know who you are. This an authentication error.
trans-unit.target: 401未经授权 ：我不知道您是谁。 这是身份验证错误。

trans-unit.source: 401
trans-unit.target: 401

trans-unit.source: 401: Again, the client should specify valid credentials.
trans-unit.target: 401 ：再次，客户端应指定有效的凭证。

trans-unit.source: 401: The client should specify credentials.
trans-unit.target: 401 ：客户端应指定凭据。

trans-unit.source: 401: The client should specify valid credentials.
trans-unit.target: 401 ：客户端应指定有效的凭据。

trans-unit.source: 401: This is practically the same as having invalid credentials in general, so the client should specify valid credentials.
trans-unit.target: 401 ：这实际上与通常具有无效凭据的相同，因此客户端应指定有效凭据。

trans-unit.source: 401: User not (correctly) authenticated, the resource/page require authentication
trans-unit.target: 401 ：用户未（正确）经过身份验证，资源/页面需要身份验证

trans-unit.source: 403 Forbidden
trans-unit.target: 403禁止

trans-unit.source: 403 Forbidden: I know who you are, but you don't have permission to access this resource. This is an authorization error.
trans-unit.target: 403 Forbidden ：我知道您是谁，但您无权访问此资源。 这是授权错误。

trans-unit.source: 403
trans-unit.target: 403

trans-unit.source: 403: If the client is blocked, specifying new credentials will not do anything.
trans-unit.target: 403 ：如果客户端被阻止，则指定新凭据将无济于事。

trans-unit.source: 403: Specifying valid credentials would not grant access to the resource, as the current credentials are already valid but only do not have permission.
trans-unit.target: 403 ：指定有效凭证不会授予对资源的访问权限，因为当前凭证已经有效，但仅没有权限。

trans-unit.source: 403: This is regardless of credentials, so specifying valid credentials cannot help.
trans-unit.target: 403 ：这与凭据无关，因此指定有效的凭据无济于事。

trans-unit.source: 403: User authenticated, but his role or permissions does not allow to access requested resource, for instance user is not an administrator and requested page is for administrators
trans-unit.target: 403 ：用户已通过身份验证，但其角色或权限不允许访问请求的资源，例如，用户不是管理员，而请求的页面是针对管理员的

trans-unit.source: 6.5.3. 403 Forbidden
trans-unit.target: 6.5.3。 403禁止

trans-unit.source: Assuming HTTP authentication (WWW-Authenticate and Authorization headers) is in use, if authenticating as another user would grant access to the requested resource, then 401 Unauthorized should be returned.
trans-unit.target: 假设正在使用HTTP身份验证 （ WWW-Authenticate和Authorization标头），如果以其他用户身份进行身份验证将授予对所请求资源的访问权限，则应返回401 Unauthorized。

trans-unit.source: Authorization will not help and the request SHOULD NOT be repeated.
trans-unit.target: 授权将无济于事，并且不应重复该请求。

trans-unit.source: FORBIDDEN: Status code (403) indicating the server understood the request but refused to fulfill it. User/agent known by the server but has insufficient credentials. Repeating request will not work, unless credentials changed, which is very unlikely in a short time span. Special case: Can be used instead of 404 to avoid revealing presence or non-presence of resource (credits @gingerCodeNinja)
trans-unit.target: 禁止 ：状态码（403），指示服务器理解了请求，但拒绝执行。 服务器已知的用户/代理，但凭据不足 。 除非更改凭据，否则重复请求将不起作用，这在短时间内几乎是不可能的。 特殊情况：可以代替404使用，以避免显示资源的存在或不存在（信用@gingerCodeNinja）

trans-unit.source: If HTTP authentication is not in use and the service a cookie-based authentication scheme as is the norm nowadays, then a 403 or a 404 should be returned.
trans-unit.target: 如果未使用HTTP身份验证，并且按当今的规范为基于cookie的身份验证服务提供服务，则应返回403或404。

trans-unit.source:
If authentication credentials were provided in the request, the
server considers them insufficient to grant access. The client
SHOULD NOT automatically repeat the request with the same
credentials. The client MAY repeat the request with new or different credentials. However, a request might be forbidden for reasons
unrelated to the credentials.
trans-unit.target:
如果请求中提供了身份验证凭据，则
服务器认为它们不足以授予访问权限。 客户端
不应自动将相同的请求重复
证书。 客户可以用新的或不同的证书重复请求。 但是，出于某些原因，请求可能被禁止
与凭据无关。

trans-unit.source: NOT FOUND: Status code (404) indicating that the requested resource is not available. User/agent known but server will not reveal anything about the resource, does as if it does not exist. Repeating will not work. This is a special use of 404 (github does it for example).
trans-unit.target: NOT FOUND ：状态代码（404），指示请求的资源不可用。 已知用户/代理，但服务器不会显示任何有关资源的信息，就像不存在该信息一样。 重复将不起作用。 这是404的一种特殊用法（例如github）。

trans-unit.source: UNAUTHORIZED: Status code (401) indicating that the request requires authentication, usually this means user needs to be logged-in (session). User/agent unknown by the server. Can repeat with other credentials. NOTE: This is confusing as this should have been named 'unauthenticated' instead of 'unauthorized'. This can also happen after login if session expired. Special case: Can be used instead of 404 to avoid revealing presence or non-presence of resource (credits @gingerCodeNinja)
trans-unit.target: UNAUTHORIZED ：状态码（401），指示请求需要身份验证 ，通常这意味着用户需要登录（会话）。 服务器未知的用户/代理。 可以重复使用其他凭据。 注意：这令人困惑，因为它应该被命名为“未经身份验证”而不是“未经授权”。 如果会话过期，登录后也可能发生这种情况。 特殊情况：可以代替404使用，以避免显示资源的存在或不存在（信用@gingerCodeNinja）

trans-unit.source: Update
trans-unit.target: Update

trans-unit.source: A clear explanation from Daniel Irvine:
trans-unit.target: Daniel Irvine的明确解释：

trans-unit.source: A resource requires authentication but no credentials were specified.
trans-unit.target: 资源需要身份验证，但未指定 凭据 。

trans-unit.source: According to RFC 2616 (HTTP/1.1) 403 is sent when:
trans-unit.target: 根据RFC 2616 （HTTP / 1.1），在以下情况下发送403：

trans-unit.source: An origin server that wishes to "hide" the current existence of a
trans-unit.target: 希望 "隐藏 "当前存在的原点服务器。

trans-unit.source: An origin server that wishes to "hide" the current existence of a forbidden target resource MAY instead respond with a status code of 404 (Not Found).
trans-unit.target: 原点服务器希望 "隐藏 "当前被禁止的目标资源的存在,可以用404(未找到)的状态代码来响应。

trans-unit.source: Another nice pictorial format of how http status codes should be used.
trans-unit.target: 另一种很好的图片格式 ，说明应如何使用http状态代码。

trans-unit.source: As mentioned by @ChrisH there are a few options for redirection (301, 302, 303, 307 or not redirecting at all and using a 401):
trans-unit.target: 如@ChrisH所提到的，有一些重定向选项（301、302、303、307或根本不重定向并使用401）：

trans-unit.source: Brief and Terse
trans-unit.target: 简明扼要、简练

trans-unit.source: Checks are usually done in this order:
trans-unit.target: 通常是按照这个顺序进行检查。

trans-unit.source: Detailed and In-Depth
trans-unit.target: 详细和深入

trans-unit.source: Difference between HTTP redirect codes
trans-unit.target: HTTP重定向代码之间的区别

trans-unit.source: For a web page that exists, but for which a user does not have sufficient privileges (they are not logged in or do not belong to the proper user group), what is the proper HTTP response to serve?
trans-unit.target: 对于一个存在的网页,但用户没有足够的权限(他们没有登录或不属于适当的用户组),那么,该如何处理HTTP响应?

trans-unit.source: From RFC2616
trans-unit.target: 摘自RFC261616

trans-unit.source: From your use case, it appears that the user is not authenticated. I would return 401.
trans-unit.target: 从你的用例来看,用户似乎没有通过验证。我将返回401。

trans-unit.source: Given the latest RFC's on the matter (7231 and 7235) the use-case seems quite clear (italics added):
trans-unit.target: 考虑到有关此问题的最新RFC（ 7231和7235 ），用例似乎很清楚（斜体添加）：

trans-unit.source: Here are some cases under that logic where an error would be returned from authentication or authorization, with important phrases bolded.
trans-unit.target: 以下是该逻辑下的一些情况,在这种情况下,认证或授权会返回错误,重要的短语加粗。

trans-unit.source: How long do browsers cache HTTP 301s?
trans-unit.target: 浏览器要缓存多长时间的HTTP 301?

trans-unit.source: I believe the reason why this has changed is RFC 2616 assumed HTTP authentication would be used when in practice today's Web apps build custom authentication schemes using for example forms and cookies.
trans-unit.target: 我相信,之所以会有这样的变化,是因为RFC 2616假设今天的Web应用在实践中使用表单和cookie等构建自定义认证方案时,会使用HTTP认证。

trans-unit.source: I don't recommend using 403 to deny access to things like /includes, because as far as the web is concerned, those resources don't exist at all and should therefore 404.
trans-unit.target: 我不建议使用403拒绝访问 /includes 之类的东西，因为就网络而言，这些资源根本不存在，因此应该为404。

trans-unit.source: I think it is important to consider that, to a browser, 401 initiates an authentication dialog for the user to enter new credentials, while 403 does not. Browsers think that, if a 401 is returned, then the user should re-authenticate. So 401 stands for invalid authentication while 403 stands for a lack of permission.
trans-unit.target: 我认为有必要考虑一下,对于浏览器来说,401会启动一个认证对话框,让用户输入新的凭证,而403不会。浏览器认为,如果401被返回,那么用户应该重新认证。所以401代表无效认证,而403代表缺乏权限。

trans-unit.source: I've emphasized the bit I think is most salient.
trans-unit.target: 我强调了我认为最突出的地方。

trans-unit.source: If apacherequires authentication (via .htaccess), and you hit Cancel, it will respond with a 401 Authorization Required
trans-unit.target: 如果apache 需要验证 （通过 .htaccess ），并且您单击 Cancel ，它将以 401 Authorization Required 响应。

trans-unit.source: If nginx finds a file, but has no access rights (user/group) to read/access it, it will respond with 403 Forbidden
trans-unit.target: 如果nginx找到文件，但是没有读取/访问文件的访问权限 （用户/组），它将以 403 Forbidden 进行响应

trans-unit.source: If authentication credentials were provided in the request, the server considers them insufficient to grant access. The client SHOULD NOT automatically repeat the request with the same credentials. The client MAY repeat the request with new or different credentials. However, a request might be forbidden for reasons unrelated to the credentials.
trans-unit.target: 如果在请求中提供了认证凭证,服务器认为这些凭证不足以授予访问权限。客户端不应以相同的凭证自动重复请求。客户端可以使用新的或不同的凭证重复请求。但是,可能会因为与凭证无关的原因而禁止请求。

trans-unit.source: If authentication credentials were provided in the request, the server considers them insufficient to grant access. The client SHOULD NOT repeat the request with the same credentials. The client MAY repeat the request with new or different credentials. However, a request might be forbidden for reasons unrelated to the credentials.
trans-unit.target: 如果请求中提供了身份验证凭据，则服务器认为它们不足以授予访问权限。 客户端不应使用相同的凭据重复该请求。 客户可以用新的或不同的证书重复请求。 但是，出于与凭据无关的原因，可能会禁止请求。

trans-unit.source: If the request already included Authorization credentials, then the 401 response indicates that authorization has been refused for those credentials.
trans-unit.target: 如果请求中已经包含了授权凭证,那么401的响应表明这些凭证的授权已经被拒绝。

trans-unit.source: If the request included authentication credentials, then the 401 response indicates that authorization has been refused for those credentials. The user agent MAY repeat the request with a new or replaced Authorization header field (Section 4.2). If the 401 response contains the same challenge as the prior response, and the user agent has already attempted authentication at least once, then the user agent SHOULD present the enclosed representation to the user, since it usually contains relevant diagnostic information.
trans-unit.target: 如果请求中包含了认证凭证,那么401响应表示这些凭证的授权被拒绝。用户代理可以用新的或替换的授权头字段重复请求(第4.2节)。如果401响应包含与前一个响应相同的挑战,而用户代理至少已经尝试过一次认证,那么用户代理应该向用户展示所附的表示,因为它通常包含相关的诊断信息。

trans-unit.source: If the request method was not HEAD and the server wishes to make
trans-unit.target: 如果请求的方法不是HEAD,而服务器希望进行

trans-unit.source: If the user is not logged in they are un-authenticated, the HTTP equivalent of which is 401 and is misleadingly called Unauthorized in the RFC. As section 10.4.2 states for 401 Unauthorized:
trans-unit.target: 如果用户未登录，则他们未经身份验证，其HTTP等效项是401，并且在RFC中被误称为“未经授权”。 如第10.4.2节所述，针对401未经授权 ：

trans-unit.source: If the user just needs to log in using you site's standard HTML login form, 401 would not be appropriate because it is specific to HTTP basic auth.
trans-unit.target: 如果用户只需要使用网站的标准HTML登录表单登录,那么401就不合适,因为它是HTTP基本认证所特有的。

trans-unit.source: If they are logged in but don't belong to the proper user group, you should return 403 Forbidden
trans-unit.target: 如果他们已登录但不属于正确的用户组，则应返回403 Forbidden

trans-unit.source: If they are not logged in at all you should return 401 Unauthorized
trans-unit.target: 如果根本没有登录，则应返回401未经授权

trans-unit.source: If you're unauthenticated, 401 is the correct response. However if you're unauthorized, in the semantically correct sense, 403 is the correct response.
trans-unit.target: 如果你是未经认证的,401是正确的回应。但是,如果你是未经授权的,从语义上讲,403是正确的响应。

trans-unit.source: In 2014 RFC 7231 (Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Semantics and Content) changed the meaning of 403:
trans-unit.target: 2014年RFC 7231(超文本传输协议(HTTP1.1)。Semantics and Content)改变了403的含义。

trans-unit.source: In English:
trans-unit.target: 用英语说:

trans-unit.source: In other words, 403 means "this resource requires some form of auth other than HTTP basic auth".
trans-unit.target: 换句话说,403意味着 "这个资源需要HTTP基本认证以外的其他形式的认证"。

trans-unit.source: In other words, if the client CAN get access to the resource by authenticating, 401 should be sent.
trans-unit.target: 换句话说,如果客户端可以通过认证获得资源的访问权限,就应该发送401。

trans-unit.source: In summary, a 401 Unauthorized response should be used for missing or bad authentication, and a 403 Forbidden response should be used afterwards, when the user is authenticated but isn’t authorized to perform the requested operation on the given resource.
trans-unit.target: 总之，当用户通过身份验证但无权对给定资源执行请求的操作时，应使用401未经授权的响应来进行丢失或错误的身份验证，然后使用403禁止响应。

trans-unit.source: In the case of 401 vs 403, this has been answered many times. This is essentially a 'HTTP request environment' debate, not an 'application' debate.
trans-unit.target: 在401与403的争论中,这个问题已经回答过很多次了。这本质上是一个 "HTTP请求环境 "的争论,而不是 "应用 "的争论。

trans-unit.source: In this case, simply not being logged in is not sufficient to send a 401 or a 403, unless you use HTTP Auth vs a login page (not tied to setting HTTP Auth). It sounds like you may be looking for a "201 Created", with a roll-your-own-login screen present (instead of the requested resource) for the application-level access to a file. This says:
trans-unit.target: 在这种情况下,仅仅是没有登录是不足以发送401或403,除非你使用HTTP Auth与登录页面(不绑定设置HTTP Auth)。听起来,你可能正在寻找一个 "201创建",有一个roll-your-own-login屏幕(而不是所请求的资源),用于应用程序级别的文件访问。这句话是这样说的。

trans-unit.source: It SHOULD describe the reason for the refusal in the entity
trans-unit.target: 它应该在实体中说明拒绝的原因。

trans-unit.source: It reflects what happens in authentication & authorization schemes employed by a number of popular web-servers and frameworks.
trans-unit.target: 它反映了许多流行的Web服务器和框架采用的身份验证和授权方案中发生的情况。

trans-unit.source: It’s also something very temporary; the server is asking you to try again.
trans-unit.target: 这也是非常临时的。 服务器要求您重试。

trans-unit.source: Meaning 1: Need to authenticate
trans-unit.target: 含义1： 需要认证

trans-unit.source: Meaning 2: Authentication insufficient
trans-unit.target: 含义2： 认证不足

trans-unit.source: Meaning if you have your own roll-your-own login process and never use HTTP Authentication, 403 is always the proper response and 401 should never be used.
trans-unit.target: 这意味着,如果你有自己的登录流程,并且从不使用HTTP认证,那么403永远是正确的响应,而401永远不应该被使用。

trans-unit.source: Meaning: Unrelated to authentication
trans-unit.target: 含义： 与身份验证无关

trans-unit.source: OWASP has some more information about how an attacker could use this type of information as part of an attack.
trans-unit.target: OWASP提供了有关攻击者如何在攻击中使用这种信息的更多信息 。

trans-unit.source: Practical Examples
trans-unit.target: 实例

trans-unit.source: RFC (2616 Section 10)

Receiving a 403 response is the server telling you, “I’m sorry. I know who you are–I believe who you say you are–but you just don’t have permission to access this resource. Maybe if you ask the system administrator nicely, you’ll get permission. But please don’t bother me again until your predicament changes.”
trans-unit.target: 服务器收到403响应，告诉您：“很抱歉。 我知道您是谁-我相信您说的是谁-但您只是没有访问此资源的权限。 也许如果您很好地询问系统管理员，您将获得许可。 但是请不要再困扰我，直到您的困境改变为止。”

trans-unit.source: Regarding 401, this is from RFC 7235 (Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Authentication):
trans-unit.target: 关于401,这是来自RFC 7235(超文本传输协议(HTTP1.1)。Authentication)。)

trans-unit.source: See RFC2616:
trans-unit.target: 参见RFC2616 ：

trans-unit.source: So the real difference is not what the problem is or even if there is a solution. The difference is what the server expects the client to do next.
trans-unit.target: 所以,真正的区别不在于问题是什么,甚至不在于是否有解决方案。区别在于服务器希望客户端下一步要做什么。

trans-unit.source: So, for authorization I use the 403 Forbidden response. It’s permanent, it’s tied to my application logic, and it’s a more concrete response than a 401.
trans-unit.target: 因此，对于授权，我使用403禁止响应。 它是永久的，与我的应用程序逻辑相关，并且比401更具体。

trans-unit.source: Something else?
trans-unit.target: 还有什么?

trans-unit.source: Something the other answers are missing is that it must be understood that Authentication and Authorization in the context of RFC 2616 refers ONLY to the HTTP Authentication protocol of RFC 2617. Authentication by schemes outside of RFC2617 is not supported in HTTP status codes and are not considered when deciding whether to use 401 or 403.
trans-unit.target: 其他答案中缺少的东西是,必须理解RFC2616中的认证和授权仅指RFC2617中的HTTP认证协议。RFC2617以外的方案的身份验证在HTTP状态码中不支持,在决定是否使用401或403时不考虑。

trans-unit.source: TL;DR
trans-unit.target: TL;DR

trans-unit.source: The 401 (Unauthorized) status code indicates that the request has not been applied because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource. The origin server MUST send a WWW-Authenticate header field (Section 4.4) containing at least one challenge applicable to the target resource. If the request included authentication credentials, then the 401 response indicates that authorization has been refused for those credentials. The client MAY repeat the request with a new or replaced Authorization header field (Section 4.1). If the 401 response contains the same challenge as the prior response, and the user agent has already attempted authentication at least once, then the user agent SHOULD present the enclosed representation to the user, since it usually contains relevant diagnostic information.
trans-unit.target: 401（未经授权）状态码表示该请求尚未应用，因为它缺少目标资源的有效身份验证凭据。 原始服务器必须发送一个包含至少一个适用于目标资源的质询的WWW-Authenticate头域（第4.4节）。 如果请求包括认证证书，则401响应指示已拒绝那些证书的授权 。 客户可以用一个新的或替换的Authorization头域（4.1节）重复请求。 如果401响应包含与先前响应相同的质询，并且用户代理已经尝试了至少一次身份验证，则用户代理应向用户呈现随附的表示，因为它通常包含相关的诊断信息。

trans-unit.source: The 401 (Unauthorized) status code indicates that the request has not been applied because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource. The server generating a 401 response MUST send a WWW-Authenticate header field (Section 4.1) containing at least one challenge applicable to the target resource.
trans-unit.target: 401（未经授权）状态码表示该请求尚未应用，因为它缺少目标资源的有效身份验证凭据。 产生401响应的服务器必须发送WWW-Authenticate头域（4.1节），该域包含至少一个适用于目标资源的质询。

trans-unit.source: The 403 (Forbidden) status code indicates that the server understood the request but refuses to authorize it. A server that wishes to make public why the request has been forbidden can describe that reason in the response payload (if any).
trans-unit.target: 403（禁止）状态码表示服务器理解了请求，但拒绝授权 。 希望公开为什么禁止请求的服务器可以在响应有效负载（如果有）中描述该原因。

trans-unit.source: The 403 (Forbidden) status code indicates that the server understood the request but refuses to authorize it. A server that wishes to make public why the request has been forbidden can describe that reason in the response payload (if any).
trans-unit.target: 403 (Forbidden)状态代码表示服务器理解请求,但拒绝授权。如果服务器希望公开为什么请求被禁止的原因,可以在响应有效载荷中描述这个原因(如果有的话)。

trans-unit.source: The first thing to keep in mind is that "Authentication" and "Authorization" in the context of this document refer specifically to the HTTP Authentication protocols from RFC 2617. They do not refer to any roll-your-own authentication protocols you may have created using login pages, etc. I will use "login" to refer to authentication and authorization by methods other than RFC2617
trans-unit.target: 首先要记住的是,本文中的 "身份验证 "和 "授权 "特指RFC 2617中的HTTP身份验证协议。它们并不指你可能使用登录页面等创建的任何卷积身份验证协议。我将使用 "login "来指代RFC2617以外的认证和授权方法。

trans-unit.source: The particular resource is inaccessible regardless of credentials.
trans-unit.target: 无论凭证如何，都无法访问特定资源 。

trans-unit.source: The request requires user authentication. ...
trans-unit.target: 该请求需要用户认证。...

trans-unit.source: The request requires user authentication. The response MUST include a WWW-Authenticate header field (section 14.47) containing a challenge applicable to the requested resource. The client MAY repeat the request with a suitable Authorization header field (section 14.8).
trans-unit.target: 该请求需要用户认证。响应必须包括一个WWW-Authenticate头字段(第14.47节),其中包含一个适用于所请求资源的挑战。客户端可以使用合适的授权头字段(第14.8节)重复请求。

trans-unit.source: The semantics of 403 (and 404) have changed over time. This is from 1999 (RFC 2616):
trans-unit.target: 403(和404)的语义随着时间的推移而改变。这是从1999年开始的(RFC 2616)。

trans-unit.source: The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it.
trans-unit.target: 服务器理解请求,但拒绝履行。

trans-unit.source: The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it. Authorization will not help and the request SHOULD NOT be repeated. If the request method was not HEAD and the server wishes to make public why the request has not been fulfilled, it SHOULD describe the reason for the refusal in the entity. If the server does not wish to make this information available to the client, the status code 404 (Not Found) can be used instead
trans-unit.target: 服务器理解请求,但拒绝执行。授权将无济于事,且请求不应重复。如果请求方法不是HEAD,而服务器希望公开为什么请求没有被满足,它应该在实体中描述拒绝的原因。如果服务器不希望向客户端提供这些信息,可以使用状态代码404(未找到)来代替。

trans-unit.source: The specified credentials are invalid but specify a valid user (or don't specify a user if a specified user is not required).
trans-unit.target: 指定的凭据 无效，但指定了一个有效的用户（如果不需要指定的用户，则不要指定该用户）。

trans-unit.source: The specified credentials have expired.
trans-unit.target: 指定的凭据已过期 。

trans-unit.source: The specified credentials are completely valid but do not suffice the particular resource, though it is possible that credentials with more permission could.
trans-unit.target: 指定的凭据完全有效，但不能满足特定资源的需求 ，尽管具有更多权限的凭据可能会这样做。

trans-unit.source: The specified credentials are completely valid but the particular client is blocked from using them.
trans-unit.target: 指定的凭证完全有效，但是特定客户端无法使用它们。

trans-unit.source: The specified credentials are in an invalid format.
trans-unit.target: 指定的凭据格式无效 。

trans-unit.source: The specified credentials reference a user which does not exist.
trans-unit.target: 指定的凭据引用了不存在的用户 。

trans-unit.source: The status code 404 (Not Found) can be used instead
trans-unit.target: 可以使用状态代码404(未找到)来代替。

trans-unit.source: There seems to be a question on the roll-your-own-login issue (application).
trans-unit.target: 好像有一个问题,就是关于 "滚蛋登录 "的问题(申请)。

trans-unit.source: There's a problem with 401 Unauthorized, the HTTP status code for authentication errors. And that’s just it: it’s for authentication, not authorization. Receiving a 401 response is the server telling you, “you aren’t authenticated–either not authenticated at all or authenticated incorrectly–but please reauthenticate and try again.” To help you out, it will always include a WWW-Authenticate header that describes how to authenticate.
trans-unit.target: 401 Unauthorized出现问题，身份验证错误的HTTP状态代码。 就是这样：它用于身份验证，而不是授权。 服务器收到401响应后，会告诉您：“您未通过身份验证-完全没有身份验证或身份验证不正确-但请重新进行身份验证，然后重试。” 为了帮助您，它将始终包含描述如何进行身份验证的WWW-Authenticate标头。

trans-unit.source: These are the meanings:
trans-unit.target: 这些都是指的意思。

trans-unit.source: This is a response generally returned by your web server, not your web application.
trans-unit.target: 这通常是由您的Web服务器返回的响应,而不是您的Web应用程序。

trans-unit.source: This is an older question, but one option that was never really brought up was to return a 404. From a security perspective, the highest voted answer suffers from a potential information leakage vulnerability. Say, for instance, that the secure web page in question is a system admin page, or perhaps more commonly, is a record in a system that the user doesn't have access to. Ideally you wouldn't want a malicious user to even know that there's a page / record there, let alone that they don't have access. When I'm building something like this, I'll try to record unauthenticate / unauthorized requests in an internal log, but return a 404.
trans-unit.target: 这是一个比较老的问题，但是从未真正提出过的一种选择是返回404。从安全角度来看，投票率最高的答案有潜在的信息泄漏漏洞 。 例如，假设所讨论的安全网页是系统管理员页面，或者更常见的是，它是用户无法访问的系统中的记录。 理想情况下，您甚至不希望恶意用户知道那里有一个页面/记录，更不用说他们没有访问权限了。 当我构建类似这样的东西时，我将尝试在内部日志中记录未认证/未授权的请求，但返回404。

trans-unit.source: This is simpler in my head than anywhere here, so:
trans-unit.target: 这在我的脑子里比这里的任何地方都简单,所以。

trans-unit.source: This leaves 403 as "you need to be logged in".
trans-unit.target: 这样一来,403就变成了 "你需要登录"。

trans-unit.source: This question was asked some time ago, but people's thinking moves on.
trans-unit.target: 这个问题在前段时间被问到了,但人们的思维却动了起来。

trans-unit.source: Thus, a 403 (or a 404) might now mean about anything. Providing new credentials might help... or it might not.
trans-unit.target: 因此,403(或404)现在可能意味着任何事情。提供新的凭证可能有帮助......也可能没有帮助。

trans-unit.source: Unauthorized indicates that the client is not RFC2617 authenticated and the server is initiating the authentication process. Forbidden indicates either that the client is RFC2617 authenticated and does not have authorization or that the server does not support RFC2617 for the requested resource.
trans-unit.target: 未授权表示客户机未通过RFC2617认证,服务器正在启动认证过程。Forbidden表示客户机已通过RFC2617认证,没有授权,或者服务器不支持RFC2617请求的资源。

trans-unit.source: What I've read on each so far isn't very clear on the difference between the two. What use cases are appropriate for each response?
trans-unit.target: 到目前为止,我所读到的关于两者之间的区别不是很清楚。每种应对方式都适合哪些用例?

trans-unit.source: What is correct HTTP status code when redirecting to a login page?
trans-unit.target: 重定向到登录页面时,正确的HTTP状态码是什么?

trans-unit.source: Whatever convention you use, the important thing is to provide uniformity across your site / API.
trans-unit.target: 无论你使用什么惯例,重要的是在你的网站API中提供统一性。

trans-unit.source: You are not, ever, allowed. Your name is not on the list, you won't ever get in, go away, don't send a re-try request, it will be refused, always. Go away.
trans-unit.target: 你是不可以的,永远都不可以。你的名字不在名单上,你永远也进不去,走吧,不要发复试请求,会被拒绝的,永远。你走吧

trans-unit.source: You are potentially allowed access but for some reason on this request you were denied. Such as a bad password? Try again, with the correct request you will get a success response instead.
trans-unit.target: 你有可能被允许访问,但由于某些原因,你的请求被拒绝了。例如密码错误?再试一次,用正确的请求,你会得到一个成功的回复。

trans-unit.source: You have stated two different cases; each case should have a different response:
trans-unit.target: 你说了两个不同的案例;每个案例应该有不同的应对措施。

trans-unit.source: and
trans-unit.target: and

trans-unit.source: forbidden target resource MAY instead respond with a status code of
trans-unit.target: 被禁止的目标资源可以用状态代码为

trans-unit.source: public why the request has not been fulfilled, it SHOULD describe the reason for the refusal in the entity. If the server does not wish to make this information available to the client, the status code 404
trans-unit.target: 拒绝请求的原因,应该在实体中描述拒绝的原因。如果服务器不希望向客户端提供这些信息,状态码404

trans-unit.source: they are not logged in or do not belong to the proper user group
trans-unit.target: 他们没有登录或不属于适当的用户组。
